content.description:
Up the center of the face.  Two-thirds of the way up is a blank section that is passed by finding a cryptic hold.  Beyond, head for the slot straight above - another cryptic move?The arete on the left provides an escape from the difficulties.

 An easier variation start on the right edge of the face and traverses in, between the penultimate and ultimate moves.
content.location: The smooth face at the right hand end of the Bandshell.  When approaching the area, this is probably the first thing you will see.

content.description: A delightful little crack system, slightly steeper than you expect it to be.
content.location: Just to the left of the Gullet, the gap in the cliff.

content.description:
Start out on the left hand corner of Bandshell's west (left) buttress.  At about 10 feet, swing around to the right side of the corner.  Continue up, eventually shifted back out to the corner. 

  There is a variation to the start, by beginning on "Encore" and bumping left to "Largo."
Start on a large flat rock, move up to the flaring slot.  Where a large crack cuts under the bulge and heads right, continue straight up the seam.
content.protection: This route might actually deserve an "X".  Small gear to about 1 inch.  The middle portion of the route may or may not be protectable.
content.location: On the prow of the buttress that defines the left-hand side of the Bandshell.

content.description: Crack five feet right of Arm Overture
content.location: To the right of the Gullet, #10 in Climber's Guide

content.description:
Crux at the bottom, pulling through the hand-crack. 

  Nice moves, but the upper crack funnels dirt.  Wear goggles.
content.protection: A couple of hand- to fist-sized pieces.
content.location: Just to the right of the Bandshell's "Gullet."

pathTokens: East Bluff 02 - East of the Quarry

content.description:
A cozy little area that is easy to miss, there are several great routes here, including "Encore," "Largo," and "Torn Joint." 

  In between Rattlesnake Ridge and Mousehole Buttress.
